Quote: You do not need to work to become spiritual. You are spiritual; you need only to remember that fact. Spirit is within you. God is within you. (67)

Author: Swami Vivekananda,  Raja-Yoga
Quote: Was there ever a more horrible blasphemy than the statement that all the knowledge of God is confined to this or that book? How dare men call God infinite, and yet try to compress Him within the covers of a little book!

Author: Eric Clapton
Quote: I found my God in music and the arts, with writers like Hermann Hesse, and musicians like Muddy Waters, Howlin' Wolf, and Little Walter. In some way, in some form, my God was always there, but now I have learned to talk to him.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: But he was pierced for our transgressions,  he was crushed for our iniquities;  the punishment that brought us peace was upon him,  and by his wounds we are healed.

Author: William Lane Craig,  Reasonable Faith
Quote: ‎"If there is no God, then man and the universe are doomed. Like prisoners condemned to death, we await our unavoidable execution. There is no God, and there is no immortality. And what is the consequence of this? It means that life itself is absurd. It means that the life we have is without ultimate significance, value, or purpose.

Author: Peter Kreeft,  Jesus-Shock
Quote: We sinned for no reason but an incomprehensible lack of love, and He saved us for no reason but an incomprehensible excess of love.

Author: Bob Goff,  Love Does: Discover a Secretly Incredible Life in an Ordinary World
Quote: Failure is just part of the process, and it's not just okay; it's better than okay. God doesn't want failure to shut us down. God didn't make it a three-strikes-and-you're-out sort of thing. It's more about how God helps us dust ourselves off so we can swing for the fences again. And all of this without keeping a meticulous record of our screw-ups.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: Like when you sit in front of a fire in winter — you are just there in front of the fire. You don't have to be smart or anything. The fire warms you.

Author: Plato
Quote: He was a wise man who invented God.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: God’s word is not just to be heard and repeated, it is to be breathed, lived, and emulated with each action.

Author: Corrie ten Boom
Quote: We never know how God will answer our prayers, but we can expect that He will get us involved in His plan for the answer. If we are true intercessors, we must be ready to take part in God’s work on behalf of the people for whom we pray.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: In the view of such harmony in the cosmos which I, with my limited human mind, am able to recognize, there are yet people who says there is no God. But what makes me really angry is that they quote me for support of such views. (The Expanded Quotable Einstein, Princeton University, page 214)

Author: Amy Carmichael,  Gold by Moonlight
Quote: Do not fight the thing in detail: turn from it. Look ONLY at your Lord. Sing. Read. Work.

Author: Bram Stoker,  Dracula
Quote: She has man's brain--a brain that a man should have were he much gifted--and woman's heart. The good God fashioned her for a purpose, believe me when He made that so good combination.

Author: Rich Mullins
Quote: We were given the Scriptures to humble us into realizing that God is right, and the rest of us are just guessing.

Author: John Piper,  A Sweet and Bitter Providence: Sex, Race, and the Sovereignty of God
Quote: God is not an employer looking for employees. He is an Eagle looking for people who will take refuge under his wings. He is looking for people who will leave father and mother and homeland or anything else that may hold them back from a life of love under the wings of Jesus.

Author: LeeAnn Taylor
Quote: We are all butterflies. Earth is our chrysalis.

Author: Augustine of Hippo
Quote: If you understood him, it would not be God.

Author: John F. MacArthur Jr.
Quote: Once I was free in the shackles of sin:Free to be tempted, just bound to give in;Free to be captive to any desire;Free to eternally burn in hell’s fire.‘Til Someone bought me and called me His slave:Bound by commands I am free to obey;Captive by beauty I’m free to adore--Sentenced to sit at His feet evermore.

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: Make peace with silence, and remind yourself that it is in this space that you'll come to remember your spirit. When you're able to transcend an aversion to silence, you'll also transcend many other miseries. And it is in this silence that the remembrance of God will be activated.

Author: Mikhail Bakunin
Quote: If God really existed, it would be necessary to abolish Him.

Author: William Blake,  The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
Quote: For every thing that lives is Holy.

Author: A.W. Tozer
Quote: The fact of God is necessary for the fact of man. Think God away and man has no ground of existence.

Author: Francis Chan,  Crazy Love: Overwhelmed by a Relentless God
Quote: Many Spirit-filled authors have exhausted the thesaurus in order to describe God with the glory He deserves. His perfect holiness, by definition, assures us that our words can't contain Him. Isn't it a comfort to worship a God we cannot exaggerate?

Author: Cecelia Ahern,  The Book of Tomorrow
Quote: Then I realised that I was the god on this occasion. I had tried to help the bluebottle, but it wouldn't let me. And then I felt sorry for God because I understood his frustration. Sometimes when people offer a helping hand, it gets pushed away. People always want to help themselves first.

Author: Doreen Virtue
Quote: Because you’re a creation of God, you reflect the Divine qualities of creativity, wisdom, and love.

Author: James Hudson Taylor
Quote: All God's giants have been weak men who did great things for God because they reackoned on God being with them.

Author: Orhan Pamuk,  Snow
Quote: There's a lot of pride involved in my refusal to believe in god.

Author: Francis Bacon
Quote: God has, in fact, written two books, not just one. Of course, we are all familiar with the first book he wrote, namely Scripture. But he has written a second book called creation.

Author: John Fowles,  The French Lieutenant's Woman
Quote: There is only one good definition of God: the freedom that allows other freedoms to exist.

Author: Kirsten Miller,  The Eternal Ones
Quote: My faith is big enough to accept all of God's wonders.

Author: Fulton J. Sheen,  Seven Words of Jesus and Mary: Lessons from Cana and Calvary
Quote: Never forget that there are only two philosophies to rule your life: the one of the cross, which starts with the fast and ends with the feast. The other of Satan, which starts with the feast and ends with the headache.

Author: Scott Cunningham,  Living Wicca: A Further Guide for the Solitary Practitioner
Quote: We are not on this planet to ask forgiveness of our deities

Author: Eugene H. Peterson,  The Jesus Way: A Conversation on the Ways That Jesus Is the Way
Quote: The way of Jesus cannot be imposed or mapped — it requires an active participation in following Jesus as he leads us through sometimes strange and unfamiliar territory, in circumstances that become clear only in the hesitations and questionings, in the pauses and reflections where we engage in prayerful conversation with one another and with him.

Author: James Scott Bell,  Sins of the Fathers
Quote: ...God created the world in six days. On the seventh day, he rested. On the eighth day, he started getting complaints. And it hasn't stopped since.

Author: Ali Shariati
Quote: My father chose my name , and my last name was chosen by my ancestors . That’s enough, I myself choose my way

Author: Stendhal
Quote: God's only excuse is that he does not exist

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables
Quote: The world looks like something God had just imaged for his own pleasure, doesn't it?

Author: Francis Chan,  Crazy Love: Overwhelmed by a Relentless God
Quote: The irony is that while God doesn't need us but still wants us, we desperately need God but don't really want Him most of the time. He treasures us and anticipates our departure from this earth to be with Him-and we wonder, indifferently, how much we have to do for Him to get by.

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: The gods have become our diseases.

Author: Brett Harris
Quote: The beauty of collaboration between older and younger generations is that we combine strength with wisdom—a surefire way to accomplish more for the glory of God.

Author: Neale Donald Walsch,  Conversations With God: An Uncommon Dialogue, Vol. 2
Quote: Start telling the truth now and never stop. Begin by telling the truth to yourself about yourself. Then tell the truth to yourself about someone else. Then tell the truth about yourself to another. Then tell the truth about another to that other. Finally, tell the truth to everyone about everything. These are the 5 levels of truth telling. This is the five-fold path to freedom.

Author: Diamanda Galás
Quote: I think God is a callous bitch not making me a lesbian. I'm deeply disappointed by my sexual interest in men.

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging
Quote: The sorrow of God lies in our fear of Him, our fear of life, and our fear of ourselves. He anguishes over our self-absorption and self-sufficiency... God's sorrow lies in our refusal to approach Him when we sinned and failed.

Author: Julia Cameron,  Finding Water: The Art of Perseverance
Quote: God does not give us more than we can handle,"I am told but I wonder if God doesn't overestimate me just a little. Or perhaps, and this is likely, I underestimate God.

Author: Peter Kreeft,  Jesus-Shock
Quote: This is the secret of life: the self lives only by dying, finds its identity (and its happiness) only by self-forgetfulness, self-giving, self-sacrifice, and agape love.

Author: Peter Kreeft,  Pocket Handbook of Christian Apologetics
Quote: If you place [your bet] with God, you lose nothing, even if it turns out that God does not exist. But if you place it against God, and you are wrong and God does exist, you lose everything.

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: The more you go with the flow of life and surrender the outcome to God, and the less you seek constant clarity, the more you will find that fabulous things start to show up in your life.

Author: Jim Butcher,  Death Masks
Quote: I wouldn't burden any decent system of faith by participating in it... I'm not agnostic. Just nonpartisan. Theological Switzerland, that's me.

Author: Annabel Pitcher,  My Sister Lives on the Mantelpiece
Quote: I stared up at the sky and raised my middle finger, just in case God was watching. I don't like being spied on.

Author: محمد متولي الشعراوي,  كيف تقرأ القرآن الكريم وتحفظه
Quote: القرآن هادي البشرية ومرشدها ونور الحياة ودستورها ، ما من شيء احتاجه البشر إلا بيَّنه اللَّه فيه نصًا أو إشارة أو إيماءً ، عَلِمه مَنْ عَلِمه ، وجهله من جهله

Author: Aristotle
Quote: The gods too are fond of a joke.

Author: Cormac McCarthy,  The Crossing
Quote: Nor does God whisper through the trees. His voice is not to be mistaken. When men hear it they fall to their knees and their souls are riven and they cry out to Him and there is no fear but only wildness of heart that springs from such longing...

Author: John Ortberg Jr.,  The Me I Want to Be: Becoming God's Best Version of You
Quote: We tend to be preoccupied by our problems when we have a heightened sense of vulnerability and a diminished sense of power. Today, see each problem as an invitation to prayer.

Author: Florence Nightingale
Quote: If I could give you information of my life it would be to show how a woman of very ordinary ability has been led by God in strange and unaccustomed paths to do in His service what He has done in her. And if I could tell you all, you would see how God has done all, and I nothing. I have worked hard, very hard, that is all; and I have never refused God anything.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Let mental culture go on advancing, let the natural sciences progress in even greater extent and depth, and the human mind widen itself as much as it desires: beyond the elevation and moral culture of Christianity, as it shines forth in the Gospels, it will not go.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; My God, my strength, in whom I will trust; My shield, and the horn of my salvation; my stronghold.

Author: V.C. Andrews,  Flowers in the Attic
Quote: People make the rules of society, not God.

Author: Arkady Strugatsky,  Roadside Picnic
Quote: The hypothesis of God, for instance, gives an incomparably absolute opportunity to understand everything and know absolutely nothing. Give man an extremely simplified system of the world and explain every phenomenon away on the basis of that system. An approach like that doesn't require any knowledge. Just a few memorized formulas plus so-called intuition and so-called common sense.

Author: Vance Havner
Quote: If you are a Christian, you are not a citizen of this world trying to get to heaven; you are a citizen of heaven making your way through this world.

Author: Sylvia Plath,  The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath
Quote: God, who am I?

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: He who defends with love will be secure; Heaven will save him, and protect him with love.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of the Island
Quote: ...the sorrows God sent us brought comfort and strength with them, while the sorrows we brought on ourselves, through folly or wickedness, were by far the hardest to bear.

Author: Lee Goff
Quote: Sometimes the strongest thing you will ever do will be to let go of someone. It will be painful, you will suffer guilt, and you will second-guess yourself, but for your own sanity and quality of life, there will come a time where you hand them to God, with your love, and trust Him to be who and what He is. May our Lord comfort you.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Man is not defiled by his impurities. It is the other man pointing out his impurities to him, whom he is defiled by. Is there anything anyone can do, to become righteous, anyway? God made us impure. If he had a problem with that, He would have made us gods, instead.

Author: Anonymous,  The Pocket Companion Bible: NKJV
Quote: Submit to God and be at peace with him; in this way prosperity will come to you.

Author: Bethany Dillon
Quote: The same sun that rises over castles and welcomes the daySpills over buildings into the streets where orphans playAnd only You can see the good in broken thingsYou took my heart of stone, and You made it homeAnd set this prisoner free

Author: Vincent van Gogh
Quote: It always strikes me, and it is very peculiar, that, whenever we see the image of indescribable and unutterable desolation—of loneliness, poverty, and misery, the end and extreme of things—the thought of God comes into one's mind.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Chronicles of Narnia
Quote: They call him Aslan in That Place,"said Eustace."What a curious name!""Not half so curious as himself,"said Eustace solemnly.

Author: Bob Goff
Quote: Every day God invites us on the same kind of adventure. It's not a trip where He sends us a rigid itinerary, He simply invites us. God asks what it is He's made us to love, what it is that captures our attention, what feeds that deep indescribable need of our souls to experience the richness of the world He made. And then, leaning over us, He whispers, "Let's go do that together.

Author: R. Dawkins,  The Blind Watchmaker
Quote: There is something infantile in the presumption that somebody else has a responsibility to give your life meaning and point… The truly adult view, by contrast, is that our life is as meaningful, as full and as wonderful as we choose to make it.

Author: Thomas Merton,  The Seven Storey Mountain
Quote: I was not sure where I was going, and I could not see what I would do when I got [there]. But you saw further and clearer than I, and you opened the seas before my ship, whose track led me across the waters to a place I had never dreamed of, and which you were even then preparing to be my rescue and my shelter and my home.

Author: Joris-Karl Huysmans
Quote: Worshiping the Devil is no more insane than worshiping God...It is precisely at the moment when positivism is at its high-water mark that mysticism stirs into life and the follies of occultism begin.

Author: Robert G. Ingersoll,  Some Mistakes of Moses
Quote: And why does this same God tell me how to raise my children when he had to drown his?

Author: Plotinus
Quote: I am striving to give back the Divine in myself to the Divine in the All.

Author: David Hume
Quote: It is an absurdity to believe that the Deity has human passions, and one of the lowest of human passions, a restless appetite for applause

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: You are the perfect creation of God. Don't allow you to be down. God is experiencing through you.

Author: Meister Eckhart
Quote: Some people want to see God with their eyes as they see a cow, and to love Him as they love a cow - for the milk and cheese and profit it brings them. This is how it is with people who love God for the sake of outward wealth or inward comfort. They do not rightly love God, when they love Him for their own advantage.

Author: David O. McKay
Quote: Man is a spiritual being, a soul, and at some period of his life everyone is possessed with an irresistible desire to know his relationship to the Infinite. . . . There is something within him which urges him to rise above himself, to control his environment, to master the body and all things physical and live in a higher and more beautiful world.

Author: Paul Valéry
Quote: God made everything out of nothing. But the nothingness shows through.

Author: Rae Carson,  The Girl of Fire and Thorns
Quote: The mind of God is a mystery and none can understand it.

Author: Thomas Merton,  The Hidden Ground Of Love: The Letters Of Thomas Merton On Religious Experience And Social Concerns
Quote: Surrender your own poverty and acknowledge your nothingness to the Lord. Whether you understand it or not, God loves you, is present in you, lives in you, dwells in you, calls you, saves you and offers you an understanding and compassion which are like nothing you have ever found in a book or heard in a sermon.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: God made a beauteous garden With lovely flowers strown,But one straight, narrow pathway That was not overgrown.And to this beauteous garden He brought mankind to live,And said "To you, my children, These lovely flowers I give.Prune ye my vines and fig trees, With care my flowers tend,But keep the pathway open Your home is at the end."God's Garden

Author: Harley King
Quote: I feel the healinghands of Godtouch my heartand kiss my soul.

Author: Kimberly Novosel
Quote: I decided I would fill the emptiness in me with God and with paint.

Author: Orson Welles
Quote: In my opinion, there are two things that can absolutely not be carried to the screen: the realistic presentation of the sexual act and praying to God.

Author: Anthony de Mello,  One Minute Wisdom
Quote: Every word, every image used for God is a distortion more than a description.

Author: Lauryn Hill
Quote: A friend once said, and I found to be true,That everyday people, they lie to God too,So what makes you think, that they won't lie to you.

Author: Tim Minchin
Quote: Science adjusts its views based on what's observedFaith is the denial of observation so that belief can be preserved.

Author: Elisabeth Elliot,  Discipline: The Glad Surrender
Quote: God will never disappoint us… If deep in our hearts we suspect that God does not love us and cannot manage our affairs as well as we can, we certainly will not submit to His discipline. …To the unbeliever the fact of suffering only convinces him that God is not to be trusted, does not love us. To the believer, the opposite is true.

Author: Fulton J. Sheen,  Seven Words of Jesus and Mary: Lessons from Cana and Calvary
Quote: Once you have surrendered yourself, you make yourself receptive. In receiving from God, you are perfected and completed.

Author: Anne Lamott,  Plan B: Further Thoughts on Faith
Quote: Teenagers who do not go to church are adored by God, but they don't get to meet some of the people who love God back.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook
Quote: I have always been a firm believer in God and the power of prayer, though to be honest, my faith has made for alist of questions I definitely want answered after I'm gone.

Author: Hector Avalos
Quote: By Hays' reasoning, penetrating a rectum with a penis is a violation of how God meant humans to function. However, penetrating a human body with a sword, a common way to kill people in biblical times, is acceptable. Apparently human bodies were designed to be penetrated by metal implements, but not by flesh.

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging
Quote: Our identity rests in God's relentless tenderness for us revealed in Jesus Christ.

Author: Charles C. Ryrie
Quote: The Bible is the greatest of all books; to study it is the noblest of all pursuits; to understand it, the highest of all goals.

Author: Jani Ortlund
Quote: I believe that a godly home is a foretaste of heaven. Our homes, imperfect as they are, must be a haven from the chaos outside. They should be a reflection of our eternal home, where troubled souls find peace, weary hearts find rest, hungry bodies find refreshment, lonely pilgrims find communion, and wounded spirits find compassion.

Author: Socrates
Quote: God takes away the minds of poets, and uses them as his ministers, as he also uses diviners and holy prophets, in order that we who hear them may know them to be speaking not of themselves who utter these priceless words in a state of unconsciousness, but that God himself is the speaker, and that through them he is conversing with us.

Author: Corrie ten Boom
Quote: If God sends us on strong paths, we are provided strong shoes.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: I have said that the soul is not more than the body,And I have said that the body is not more than the soul,And nothing, not God, is greater to one than one's-self is,

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: The humble sinner will sometimes be interpreted as one of the filthiest in the eyes of man yet immersed in the eyes of God, and this is due to the volition of honesty regarding his own corruption.

Author: Ron Sanders
Quote: CONCERNED BUT NOT CONSUMED!

Author: Max Lucado,  Traveling Light: Releasing the Burdens You Were Never Intended to Bear
Quote: Philosophers can debate the meaning of life, but you need a Lord who can declare the meaning of life.

Author: Fulton J. Sheen,  Life Is Worth Living
Quote: When a child is given to his parents, a crown is made for that child in Heaven, and woe to the parents who raise a child without consciousness of that eternal crown!

Author: Eleanor Powell
Quote: What we are is God's gift to us. What we become is our gift to God.

Author: Brennan Manning,  The Ragamuffin Gospel: Good News for the Bedraggled, Beat-Up, and Burnt Out
Quote: For Ragamuffins, God's name is Mercy. We see our darkness as a prized possession because it drives us into the heart of God. Without mercy our darkness would plunge us into despair - for some, self-destruction. Time alone with God reveals the unfathomable depths of the poverty of the spirit. We are so poor that even our poverty is not our own: It belongs to the mysterium tremendum of a loving God.

Author: Denis Johnson,  Jesus' Son
Quote: Sometimes what I wouldn't give to have us sitting in a bar again at 9:00 a.m. telling lies to one another, far from God.

Author: Sam Childers,  Another Man's War: The True Story of One Man's Battle to Save Children in the Sudan
Quote: Since that day there is nothing anyone could ever say to convince me that one person cannot change a nation. One person can do unbelievable things. All it takes is that one person who's willing to risk everything to make it happen.

Author: Graham Greene
Quote: I have never understood why people who can swallow the enormous improbability of a personal God boggle at a personal Devil.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: God is the most beautiful, and beauty is the expression of God. If you can't appreciate beauty in the world how can you understand God?

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: Family, friends and relationships are the blessings of the God. They are the best way to access God.

Author: Keith Green
Quote: If your heart takes more pleasure in reading novels, or watching TV, or going to the movies, or talking to friends, rather than just sitting alone with God and embracing Him, sharing His cares and His burdens, weeping and rejoicing with Him, then how are you going to handle forever and ever in His presence...? You'd be bored to tears in heaven, if you're not ecstatic about God now!

Author: Ruth Hurmence Green,  The Born Again Skeptic's Guide To The Bible
Quote: I am now convinced that children should not be subjected to the frightfulness of the Christian religion [...]. If the concept of a father who plots to have his own son put to death is presented to children as beautiful and as worthy of society's admiration, what types of human behavior can be presented to them as reprehensible?

Author: Brother Andrew,  The Narrow Road: Stories of Those Who Walk This Road Together
Quote: I have come to see clearly that life is more than self. It is more than doing what I want, striving for what will benefit me, dreaming of all I can be. Life is all about my relationship with God. There is no higher calling, no loftier dream, and no greater goal than to live, breathe, and be poured out for Jesus Christ."--Jamie in Brother Andrew's "The Calling

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.
Quote: One day I’ll have my appointment with death, and every day I call out to God to see if I can reschedule for a later date.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
Quote: My God, if I had a heart, I would write my hate on ice, and wait for the sun to show.

Author: Anne Lamott,  Traveling Mercies: Some Thoughts on Faith
Quote: Mine was a patchwork God, sewn together from bits of rag and ribbon, Eastern and Western, pagan and Hebrew, everything but the kitchen sink and Jesus.

Author: Khaled Hosseini,  The Kite Runner: A Portrait of the Marc Forster Film
Quote: If there's a God out there, then i would hope he has more important things to attend to than my drinking scotch or eating pork.

Author: Amy Carmichael
Quote: He hath never failed thee yet.Never will His love forget.O fret not thyself nor letThy heart be troubled,Neither let it be afraid.

Author: Emil Cioran
Quote: Think of God and not religion, of ecstasy and not mysticism. The difference between the theoretician of faith and the believer is as great as between the psychiatrist and the psychotic.

Author: Ali Shariati
Quote: I like Dancing of Indian girls more than my parents’ prayers . Because they dance with love and passion . But my parents just say their prayers because they got used to it .

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: God, who foresaw your tribulation, has specially armed you to go through it, not without pain but without stain.

Author: Alexander Pope
Quote: Nature and Nature's laws lay hid in night:God said, Let Newton be! and all was light.

Author: Alan W. Watts,  Zen and the Beat Way
Quote: It is interesting that Hindus, when they speak of the creation of the universe do not call it the work of God, they call it the play of God, the Vishnu lila, lila meaning play. And they look upon the whole manifestation of all the universes as a play, as a sport, as a kind of dance — lila perhaps being somewhat related to our word lilt

Author: Jules Barbey d'Aurevilly,  Les Diaboliques
Quote: For in Paris, whenever God puts a pretty woman there (the streets), the Devil, in reply, immediately puts a fool to keep her.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.

Author: John Steinbeck,  The Grapes of Wrath
Quote: You got a God. Don't make no difference if you don' know what he looks like.

Author: Laura Pedersen,  Best Bet
Quote: Coincidence is God's way of being anonymous.

Author: Francine Rivers,  Redeeming Love
Quote: Michael had once read to her how God had cast a man and woman out of paradise. Yet, for all their human faults and failures. God had shown them the way back in.

Author: Andy Rooney,  Sincerely, Andy Rooney
Quote: We all ought to understand we're on our own. Believing in Santa Claus doesn't do kids any harm for a few years but it isn't smart for them to continue waiting all their lives for him to come down the chimney with something wonderful. Santa Claus and God are cousins.

Author: Habeeb Akande
Quote: I may not be where I want to be but I'm thankful for not being where I used to be.

Author: Tim Tebow,  Through My Eyes
Quote: You and I were created by God to be so much more than normal…Following the crowd is not a winning approach to life. In the end it’s a loser’s game, because we never become who God created us to be by trying to be like everybody else.

Author: H.G. Wells,  The War of the Worlds
Quote: Be a man!... What good is religion if it collapses under calamity? Think of what earthquakes and floods, wars and volcanoes, have done before to men! Did you think that God had exempted [us]? He is not an insurance agent.

Author: Karl Rahner,  The Need and the Blessing of Prayer
Quote: When man is with God in awe and love, then he is praying.

Author: Eben Alexander,  Proof of Heaven: A Neurosurgeon's Journey into the Afterlife
Quote: Communicating with God is the most extraordinary experience imaginable, yet at the same time it's the most natural one of all, because God is present in us at all times. Omniscient, omnipotent, personal-and loving us without conditions. We are connected as One through our divine link with God.

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: There is only one all pervading God. It has only one message - Love all, encompass all and transcend the limits of the selfish gene.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: God favors men and women who delight in being made worthy of happiness before the happiness itself.

Author: Steven James,  How to Smell Like God: True Stories Burning with the Scent of Heaven
Quote: God dances with the outcast.

Author: Gary Parker
Quote: If faith never encounters doubt, if truth never struggles with error, if good never battles evil, how can faith know its own power? In my own pilgrimage, if I had to choose between a faith that has stared doubt in the eye and made it blink, or a naive faith that has never known the firing line of doubt, I will choose the former every time.

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: A cannonball travels only two thousand miles an hour; light travels two hundred thousand miles a second. Such is the superiority of Jesus Christ over Napoleon.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: It is far more comforting to think God listened and said no, than to think that nobody’s out there.

Author: Lance Armstrong
Quote: If there was a god, I'd still have both nuts.

Author: David Eagleman,  Sum: Forty Tales from the Afterlives
Quote: It is only through us that God lives. When we abandon him, he dies.

Author: Louis Zamperini,  Devil at My Heels: A Heroic Olympian's Astonishing Story of Survival as a Japanese POW in World War II
Quote: Yet a part of you still believes you can fight and survive no matter what your mind knows. It's not so strange. Where there's still life, there's still hope. What happens is up to God.

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: God wanted to make heaven and the earth is that heaven. Nowhere in the universe there is so much love, life, beauty and peace. Enjoy your stay with the fellow beings.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: The New King James Version
Quote: I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is the power of God for the salvation of everyone who believes: first for the Jew, then for the Gentile.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Handle with Care
Quote: A sacrament--like marriage--means living a life better than your natural instincts, so that you're modeling God. And God never gives up.

Author: Amy Reed,  Clean
Quote: Do you remember? Do you remember the world before the poison?

Author: Jeffrey Lang,  Even Angels Ask: A Journey to Islam in America
Quote: يبدو اننا جميعا بحاجة كي نؤمن بأحد ما أو شيء ما. فالحياة دون معنى او اتجاه بائسة حقا. ويبدوانه يتوجب ان نحيا من اجل هدف او شيء ما عزيز علينا ونموت من اجله، سواء كان هذا الهدف او الشيء مبدأ سياسي او خطة حياتية او أمة اوحلما او فكرة او مالا او اسرة. اعتقد ان التقديس هو جبلة في الانسان، وأن قدرنا هو أن نكون عبيدا سواء شئنا ذلك ام ابينا.

Author: Carl Sagan,  Contact
Quote: If God is omnipotent and omniscient, why didn't he start the universe out in the first place so it would come out the way he wants? Why's he constantly repairing and complaining? No, there's one thing the Bible makes clear: The biblical God is a sloppy manufacturer. He's not good at design, he's not good at execution. He'd be out of business, if there was any competition.

Author: Andrew Davidson,  The Gargoyle
Quote: There is no logical reason to believe in God. There are emotional reasons, certainly, but I cannot have faith that nothing is something simply because it would be reassuring. I can no more believe in God than I can believe an invisible monkey lives in my ass; however, I would believe in both if they could be scientifically proven.

Author: Joseph Campbell,  Thou Art That: Transforming Religious Metaphor
Quote: It may be a species of impudence to think that the way you understand God is the way God is. (60).

Author: M. Russell Ballard
Quote: It may not always be easy, convenient or politically correct to stand for truth and right, but it is the right thing to do. Always.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: O Lord, you have searched me and you know me.

Author: Simon Van Booy
Quote: I think music is what language once aspired to be. Music allows us to face God on our own terms because it reaches beyond life.

Author: أحمد العسيلي,  كتاب مالوش اسم
Quote: الصدف ما بتتحكمش في حياتك لإنك مش صدفة، إنت نفسك قدر.

Author: Max Lucado,  Traveling Light: Releasing the Burdens You Were Never Intended to Bear
Quote: God leads us. God will do the right thing at the right time. And what a difference that makes.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: When I touched her body,I believed she was God.In the curves of her formI found the birth of Man,the creation of the world,and the origin of all life.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
Quote: If God hadn't rested on Sunday, He would have had time to finish the world.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: عندما يمنحك الله الحياة ، من واجبك (ومن حقك ككائن بشري) أن تجد شيئًا جميلًا فيها ، مهما كان ضئيلًا

Author: Mandy Hale,  The Single Woman: Life, Love, and a Dash of Sass
Quote: There is never a moment when God is not in control. Relax! He’s got you covered.

Author: Graham Greene
Quote: If I stopped loving Him, I would cease to believe in His love. If I loved God, then I would believe in His love for me. It's not enough to need it. We have to love first, and I don't know how. But I need it, how I need it.

Author: Durgesh Satpathy,  Equating the Equations of Insanity: A Journey from Grief to Victory
Quote: was it scripted by God or I am playing with my life.

Author: Jon Krakauer,  Under the Banner of Heaven: A Story of Violent Faith
Quote: Common sense is no match for the voice of God.

Author: Sinclair Lewis,  Elmer Gantry
Quote: The Maker of the universe with stars a hundred thousand light-years apart was interested, furious, and very personal about it if a small boy played baseball on Sunday afternoon.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard
Quote: The stone that was rolled before Christ's tomb might appropriately be called the philosopher's stone because its removal gave not only the pharisees but, now for 1800 years, the philosophers so much to think about.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Horse and His Boy
Quote: Then Hwin, though shaking all over, gave a strange little neigh and trotted across to the Lion. "Please,"she said, "you're so beautiful. You may eat me if you like. I'd sooner be eaten by you than fed by anyone else.

Author: Eugene H. Peterson
Quote: It is not easy to convey a sense of wonder, let alone resurrection wonder, to another. It’s the very nature of wonder to catch us off guard, to circumvent expectations and assumptions. Wonder can’t be packaged, and it can’t be worked up. It requires some sense of being there and some sense of engagement.

Author: Morris Gleitzman,  Grace
Quote: Don't sit back and wait for God to do it all. Ask for His advice, but be prepared to do the hard yards yourself.

Author: Liz Curtis Higgs,  Here Burns My Candle
Quote: If the Almighty directs our steps, we've no need to look back over our shoulders.

Author: Ann Hood,  Comfort: A Journey Through Grief
Quote: Even now, there are still days so beautiful, I almost believe in God.

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging
Quote: Live in the wisdom of accepted tenderness. Tenderness awakens within the security of knowing we are thoroughly and sincerely liked by someone...Scripture suggests that the essence of the divine nature is compassion and that the heart of God is defined by tenderness.

Author: Anonymous,  The Quran / القرآن الكريم
Quote: It is He Who sent down to thee, in truth, the Book (Quran), confirming what went before it; and He sent down the Law (of Moses) and the Gospel (of Jesus) before this, as a guide to mankind, and He sent down the criterion (Quran) (of judgment between right and wrong). - Holy Quran 3:3

Author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging
Quote: While the impostor draws his identity from past achievements and the adulation of others, the true self claims identity in its belovedness. We encounter God in the ordinariness of life: not in the search for spiritual highs and extraordinary, mystical experiences but in our simple presence in life.

Author: Max Lucado,  Experiencing the Heart of Jesus: Knowing His Heart, Feeling His Love
Quote: The wizard [of Oz] says look inside yourself and find self. God says look inside yourself and find [the Holy Spirit]. The first will get you to Kansas. The latter will get you to heaven.Take your pick.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,  Faust, Part One
Quote: Wild dreams torment me as I lie. And though a god lives in my heart, though all my power waken at his word, though he can move my every inmost part - yet nothing in the outer world is stirred. thus by existence tortured and oppressed I crave for death, I long for rest.

Author: Eric Wilson,  A Shred of Truth
Quote: As fallible humans, we usually slip too far over one edge or the other - all wrath and judgment or all grace and love.

Author: James Madison,  Letters and Other Writings of James Madison Volume 3
Quote: Religious bondage shackles and debilitates the mind, and unfits it for every noble enterprise, every expanded prospect.[Letter to William Bradford Jr. April 1 1774]

Author: Malcolm X
Quote: إن عبادة الإله الواحد وحدها ستقرب الانسان من السلام الذي يتكلم عليه الجميع ولايفعل أحد شيئاً لتحقيقه.

Author: Emmet Fox
Quote: The art of life is to live in the present moment and to make that moment as perfect as we can by the realization that we are the instruments and expression of God himself.

Author: Aaron B. Powell,  Doomsday Diaries III: Luke the Protector
Quote: The world is a goddamned evil place, the strong prey on the weak, the rich on the poor; I’ve given up hope that there is a God that will save us all. How am I supposed to believe that there’s a heaven and a hell when all I see now is hell.

Author: Yann Martel
Quote: Faith in God is an opening up, a letting go, a deep trust, a free act of love - but sometimes it was so hard to love.

Author: Billy Corgan
Quote: I've always been spiritual but I've never had a proper context, and it took me a while to find the proper context. It's hard to realize you can have any kind of relationship with God you want... and so I now have a punk rock relationship with God

Author: Roméo Dallaire,  Shake Hands With The Devil
Quote: I know there is a God because in Rwanda I shook hands with the devil. I have seen him, I have smelled him and I have touched him. I know the devil exists and therefore I know there is a God.

Author: Doreen Valiente,  Charge of the Goddess: The Mother of Modern Witchcraft
Quote: Let my worship be within the heart that rejoices, for behold, all acts of love and pleasure are my rituals.Therefore, let there be beauty and strength, power and compassion, honor and humility, mirth and reverence within you.

Author: Neal A. Maxwell
Quote: I testify that He is utterly incomparable in what He is, what He knows, what He has accomplished and what He has experienced. Yet, movingly, He calls us His Friends

Author: Elisabeth Elliot,  Passion and Purity: Learning to Bring Your Love Life Under Christ's Control
Quote: Our vision is so limited we can hardly imagine a love that does not show itself in protection from suffering. The love of God is of a different nature altogether. It does not hate tragedy. It never denies reality. It stands in the very teeth of suffering.

Author: Deepak Chopra,  The Book of Secrets: Unlocking the Hidden Dimensions of Your Life
Quote: Be content not with your lot in life but with being here in the flow of life. The glories of creation are in your very cells; you are made of the same mindstuff as the angels, the stars, and god himself.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: Any patch of sunlight in a wood will show you something about the sun which you could never get from reading books on astronomy. These pure and spontaneous pleasures are ‘patches of Godlight’ in the woods of our experience.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: We must transcend the illusion that money or power has any bearing on our worthiness as children of God.

Author: Sue Monk Kidd,  The Secret Life of Bees
Quote: Look, I know you meant well creating the world and all, but how could you let it get away from you like this? How come you couldn't stick with your original idea of paradise? People's lives were a mess.

Author: Teresa Medeiros,  Charming the Prince
Quote: Before you came into my life, I believed that God had abandoned me.Now I know that He has blessed me beyond measure. -sir Bannor-

Author: Teresa Medeiros,  A Whisper of Roses
Quote: Women are delicate creatures. Fragile. Gentle. Made by God to be sheltered from the harshness of this world..Morgan MacDonnell

Author: Damien Echols,  Life After Death
Quote: Those with less curiosity or ambition just mumble that God works in mysterious ways. I intend to catch him in the act.

Author: Sharon Shinn,  Archangel
Quote: Are you asking me if there is a god?' he said, still in that soft voice. 'All I can say is, I believe there is. I feel him when I sing. He has responded to my prayers countless times. He guides my actions and he dwells in my heart. I know he is there.

Author: Mark Gorman
Quote: Marriage isn't about Winning - It's about Lasting

Author: Said Nursî
Quote: Do what you do only for God's sake, start for God's sake, work for God's sake, and act within the sphere of God's good approval.

Author: Gretchen Rubin,  The Happiness Project: Or Why I Spent a Year Trying to Sing in the Morning, Clean My Closets, Fight Right, Read Aristotle, and Generally Have More Fun
Quote: ... one flaw throws the loveliness of [everything else] into focus. I remember reading that Shakers deliberately introduced a mistake into the things they made, to show that man shouldn't aspire to the perfection of God. Flawed can be more perfect than perfection.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Three Musketeers
Quote: Everyone knows that God protects drunkards and lovers.

Author: Roman Payne,  The Wanderess
Quote: Why do we mortals wonder if it is through 'human chaos' or through 'divine perfection' when the world guides us to some magical event? In either case, is not the result the same? Is the result not 'divine perfection?

Author: R.A. Salvatore,  Siege of Darkness
Quote: But what of faith? What of fidelity and loyalty? Complete trust? Faith is not granted by tangible proof. It comes from the heart and the soul. If a person needs proof of god's existence, then the very notion of spirituality is diminished into sensuality and we have reduced what is holy into what is logical.-Drizzt Do'urden

Author: Judah Smith,  Jesus Is: Find a New Way to Be Human
Quote: Don't allow the opinions of other people to shape your concept of him. Get to know him yourself, and let the goodness of God change you from the inside out.

Author: Saadi
Quote: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.

Author: Charles M. Schulz,  Charles M. Schulz: Conversations
Quote: I don't think God wants to be worshiped. I think the only pure worship of God is by loving one another, and I think all other forms of worship became a substitute for the love that we should show one another.

Author: Anne Graham
Quote: For years we've been telling God to get out of our schools, to get out of our government and to get out of our lives. And being the gentleman He is, I believe He has calmly backed out. How can we expect God to give us His blessing and His protection if we demand He leave us alone?

Author: John Irving,  A Prayer for Owen Meany
Quote: O God — please give him back! I shall keep asking You.

Author: Sue Augustine,  When Your Past Is Hurting Your Present
Quote: I want to encourage you by letting you know that there’s hope for you and your situation whatever you are dealing with. God is intimately involved with every detail of your future and His desire is for you to be an overcomer.

Author: Kimberly Novosel,  Loved
Quote: I told him I had once lost everything I had, too, and that I think that can be God’s way of building walls around us to force us to look up at Him.

Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon,  Grace God's Unmerited Favor
Quote: O child of God, be more careful to keep the way of the Lord, more concentrated in heart in seeking His glory, and you will see the loving-kindness and the tender mercy of the Lord in your life.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.

Author: Gerard Manley Hopkins
Quote: The world is charged with the grandeur of God.

Author: Peter Deunov
Quote: If you wish to befriend someone, look for a person who loves first God then themselves. If they love God, they will be able to love their neighbor, too.

Author: Amy Carmichael
Quote: Bare heights of loneliness...a wilderness whose burning winds sweep over glowing sands, what are they to HIM? Even there He can refresh us, even there He can renew us.

Author: Jim Butcher,  Grave Peril
Quote: But I don't understand God. I don't understand how he could see the way people treat one another, and not chalk up the whole human race as a bad idea.

Author: Josemaría Escrivá,  Christ Is Passing by
Quote: God is here. This truth should fill our lives, and every Christmas should be for us a new and special meeting with God, when we allow his light and grace to enter deep into our soul.

Author: Mary Doria Russell,  The Sparrow
Quote: I believe in God the way I believe in quarks. People whose business it is to know about quantum physics or religion tell me they have good reason to believe that quarks and God exist. And they tell me that if I wanted to devote my life to learning what they've learned, I'd find quarks and God just like they did.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  The Days of Yay are Here! Wake Me Up When They're Over.
Quote: Not only do I not believe in not believing in God, I’m also a big supporter of crutches, canes, walkers, and anything that helps support man through difficult times.

Author: John H. Groberg,  The Other Side of Heaven
Quote: Sometimes God calms the storm and sometimes He calms his child.

Author: Robert A. Schuller
Quote: God is alive, real, and wants to heal you in every aspect of your life where you are hurting.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: In great contests each party claims to act in accordance with the will of God. Both may be, and one must be wrong. God cannot be for, and against the same thing at the same time.

Author: Marquis de Sade
Quote: Are your convictions so fragile that mine cannot stand in opposition to them? Is your God so illusory that the presence of my Devil reveals his insufficiency?

Author: Paul E. Miller,  A Praying Life: Connecting with God in a Distracting World
Quote: God takes everyone he loves through a desert. It is his cure for our wandering hearts, restlessly searching for a new Eden... The best gift of the desert is God's presence... The protective love of the Shepherd gives me courage to face the interior journey.

Author: Jean-Paul Sartre
Quote: All men are Prophets or else God does not exist.

Author: John Ortberg Jr.,  The Me I Want to Be: Becoming God's Best Version of You
Quote: The goal of prayer is to live all of my life and speak all of my words in the joyful awareness of the presence of God.Prayer becomes real when we grasp the reality and goodness of God's constant presence with 'the real me.' Jesus lived his everyday life in conscious awareness of his Father.

Author: Boy Scouts of America
Quote: On my honor, I will do my bestTo do my duty To God and my country

Author: Ana Monnar
Quote: I see the glass half full and thank God for what I have.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: The whole war between the atheist and the theist comes down to this: the atheist believes a 'what' created the universe; the theist believes a 'who' created the universe.

Author: Colum McCann,  Let the Great World Spin
Quote: Rather he consoled himself with the fact that, in the real world, when he looked closely into the darkness he might find the presence of a light, damaged and bruised, but a little light all the same.

Author: A.W. Tozer
Quote: When we try to focus our thought upon One who is pure uncreated being we may see nothing at all, for He dwelleth in light that no man can approach unto. Only by faith and love are we able to glimpse Him as He passes by our shelter in the cleft of the rock.

Author: William Nicholson,  Shadowlands
Quote: Self-sufficiency is the enemy of salvation. If you are self-sufficient, you have no need of God. If you have no need of God, you do not seek Him. If you do not seek Him, you will not find Him.

Author: William Blake,  Songs of Innocence and of Experience
Quote: When the stars threw down their spears, and watered heaven with their tears, did he smile his work to see? Did he who made the Lamb make thee?

Author: Rachel Held Evans,  Evolving in Monkey Town: How a Girl Who Knew All the Answers Learned to Ask the Questions
Quote: God's ways are higher than our ways not because he is less compassionate than we are but because he is more compassionate than we can ever imagine.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: Man is a demon, man is a god. Both true.

Author: Sorin Cerin,  Wisdom Collection: The Book of Wisdom
Quote: Where I will find peace other than in oblivion?

Author: Hillary Jordan,  When She Woke
Quote: You don't have to stop thinking and asking questions to believe in God, child. If He'd wanted a flock of eight billion sheep, He wouldn't have given us opposable thumbs, much less free will.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: May the God who gives endurance and encouragement give you a spirit of unity among yourselves as you follow Christ Jesus, so that with one heart and mouth you may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Author: Augustine of Hippo
Quote: We speak, but it is God who teaches.

Author: Augustine of Hippo
Quote: The peace of the celestial city is the perfectly ordered and harmonious enjoyment of God, and of one another in God. (City of God, Book 19)

Author: Orison Swett Marden,  Learn to Expect a Great Deal of Life
Quote: The greatest thing a man can do in this world, is to make the most possible out of the stuff that has been given him. This is success, and there is no other.

Author: John Ortberg Jr.,  The Me I Want to Be: Becoming God's Best Version of You
Quote: To love someone is to desire and work toward their becoming the best version of themselves. The one person in all the universe who can do this perfectly for you is God.

Author: Jayce O'Neal
Quote: Cynicism is when a small mind and a hurt heart rejects the hope, love, and truth of a big and caring God.

Author: Martin Luther,  Commentary on Galatians
Quote: To be convinced in our hearts that we have forgiveness of sins and peace with God by grace alone is the hardest thing.

Author: Jim Elliot
Quote: Dreams are tawdry when compared with the leading of God, and not worthy of the aura of wonder we usually surround them with. God only doeth wonders. He does nothing else. His hand can work nothing less.

Author: Richelle Mead,  Vampire Academy
Quote: I had a standing agreement with god. I'd agree to believe in him, barely, so long as he let me sleep in on Sundays.

Author: Robin Lee Hatcher,  Fit to Be Tied
Quote: God makes each one of us for the time into which we are born. He creates us for a purpose. Our job is to know Him well, discover what He created us to do, and then do it for all we're worth for the rest of our lives. Ask God to show you your purpose. He will answer.

Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Mortality
Quote: If I convert it's because it's better that a believer dies than that an atheist does.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  Fear and Trembling
Quote: For he who loves God without faith reflects on himself, while the person who loves God in faith reflects on God.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: Music is, to me, proof of the existence of God. It is so extraordinarily full of magic, and in tough times of my life I can listen to music and it makes such a difference.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: For all works and things, which are either commanded or forbidden by God and thus have been instituted by the supreme Majesty, are 'musts.' Nevertheless, no one should be dragged to them or away from them by the hair, for I can drive no man to heaven or beat him into it with a club.

Author: Robert C. Shannon
Quote: Never pity missionaries; envy them. They are where the real action is -- where life and death, sin and grace, Heaven and Hell converge.

Author: Xenophanes
Quote: Men always makes gods in their own image.

Author: Thomas Harris,  The Silence of the Lambs
Quote: God's creatures who cried themselves to sleep stirred to cry again.

Author: Stephen King,  The Stand
Quote: There’s always a choice. That’s God’s way, always will be. Your will is still free. Do as you will. There’s no set of leg-irons on you. But... this is what God wants of you.

Author: Peter Barnes,  The Ruling Class: A Baroque Comedy
Quote: How do you know when you're God?""When I pray to him I find I am talking to myself.

Author: Charles Dickens,  Our Mutual Friend
Quote: [She wasn't] a logically reasoning woman, but God is good, and hearts may count in heaven as high as heads.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: God created heaven on earth but man created hell.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451
Quote: I often wonder if God recognizes His own son the way we've dressed him up, or is it dressed him down?

Author: Thaddeus of Vitovnica,  Our Thoughts Determine Our Lives: The Life and Teachings of Elder Thaddeus of Vitovnica
Quote: It is of great significance if there is a person who truly prays in a family. Prayer attracts God's Grace and all the members of the family feel it, even those whose hearts have grown cold. Pray always.

Author: Thaddeus of Vitovnica,  Our Thoughts Determine Our Lives: The Life and Teachings of Elder Thaddeus of Vitovnica
Quote: One must love God first, and only then can one love one's closest of kin and neighbors. We must not be idols to one another, for such is not the will of God.

Author: Glenn Pemberton,  Hurting with God
Quote: We live in a world that is beyond our control, and life is in a constant flux of change. So we have a decision to make: keep trying to control a storm that is not going to go away or start learning how to live within the rain.

Author: Matthew Henry
Quote: The fear of God reigning in the heart is the beauty of the soul.

Author: Evinda Lepins
Quote: Your current circumstances are part of your redemption story He is writing.

Author: Pope Benedict XVI,  God Is Love: Deus Caritas Est
Quote: If in my life I fail completely to heed others, solely out of a desire to be 'devout' and to perform my 'religious duties', then my relationship with God will also grow arid. It becomes merely 'proper', but loveless.

Author: Paul David Tripp,  Instruments in the Redeemer's Hands: People in Need of Change Helping People in Need of Change
Quote: Embedded in the larger story of redemption is a principle we must not miss: God uses ordinary people to do extraordinary things in the lives of others.

Author: Samuel Butler
Quote: Prayers are to men as dolls are to children.

Author: John Eldredge,  The Sacred Romance: Drawing Closer to the Heart of God
Quote: The true story of every person in this world is not the story you see, the external story. The true story of each person is the journey of his or her heart.

Author: Alexis de Tocqueville,  Democracy in America
Quote: I am unaware of his plans but I shall never stop believing in them because I cannot fathom them and I prefer to mistrust my own intellectual capacities than his justice.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: No matter what the cause, God is only as willing as you are.

Author: Damon Thueson
Quote: With or without God, good decisions can be made; But only with God will great decisions be made.

Author: Esther Earl,  This Star Won't Go Out: The Life and Words of Esther Grace Earl
Quote: God is the reason I’m surviving, but he’s sure used you in my life wonderfully. I love you.

Author: Tessa Afshar,  Pearl in the Sand
Quote: I mean that the reason God seems to act in ways that make no sense to us is that our perceptions are wrong. Our expectations are subtly twisted. We long for things that harm us and run from the things that grow and heal us. We think good is bad and bad is good. God acts rightly, but to us, it seems confusing. Or sometimes plain wrong.

Author: Erica Jong
Quote: the body is wiser than its inhabitants. the body is the soul. the body is god’s messenger.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: To realize the truth, you have to cross the boundaries of all religions and prophets.

Author: Max Lucado,  3:16: The Numbers of Hope
Quote: You will be at your best forever, Even now you have good moments. Occasional glimpses of your heavenly self. When you change your baby's diaper, forgive your boss's temper, tolerate your spouse's moodiness, you display traces of saintliness.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Easily mistaken, it is not about a love for adversity, it is about knowing a strength and a faith so great that adversity, in all its adverse manifestations, hardly even exists.

Author: Alan M. Dershowitz,  Letters to a Young Lawyer
Quote: I have always considered "Pascal's Wager"a questionable bet to place, since any God worth believing in would prefer an honest agnostic to a calculating hypocrite.

Author: Chairil Anwar,  Derai-derai Cemara
Quote: Hidup hanya menunda kekalahan.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: It is said that God is always on the side of the big battalions.

Author: Oswald Chambers
Quote: Am I as spontaneously kind to God as I used to be, or am I only expecting God to be kind to me? Am I full of the little things that cheer His heart over me, or am I whimpering because things are going hardly with me? There is no joy in the soul that has forgotten what God prizes.

Author: Frank Herbert
Quote: To be a god can ultimately become boring and degrading. There'd be reason enough for the invention of free will! A god might wish to escape into sleep and be alive only in the unconscious projections of his dream-creatures.

Author: Stephen Crane,  Complete Poems of Stephen Crane
Quote: Two or three angelsCame near to the earth.They saw a fat church.Little black streams of peopleCame and went in continually.And the angels were puzzledTo know why the people went thus,And why they stayed so long within.

Author: J.D. Robb,  Conspiracy in Death
Quote: God is dead and I am his replacement.

Author: محمد متولي الشعراوي,  كيف تقرأ القرآن الكريم وتحفظه
Quote: القرآن الكريم ليس إعجازًا في البلاغة فقط ، ولكنه يحوي إعجازًا في كل ما يمكن للعقل البشري أن يحوم حوله ، فكل مفكر متدبر في كلام اللَّه يجد إعجازًا في القرآن الكريم . فالذي درس البلاغة رأى الإعجاز البلاغي ، والذي تعلم الطب وجد إعجازًا طبيًا في القرآن الكريم . وعالم النباتات رأى إعجازًا في آيات القرآن الكريم ، وكذلك عالم الفلك .

Author: Stephen King,  Desperation
Quote: You said 'God is cruel' the way a person who's lived his whole life on Tahiti might say 'Snow is cold'. You knew, but you didn't understand."He stepped close to David and put his palms on the boy's cold cheeks. "Do you know how cruel your God can be, David. How fantastically cruel?

Author: Johnny Hart
Quote: Science Fiction: Any scientific acclaim that omits God.

Author: R.A. Salvatore,  Sojourn
Quote: You view the gods as entities without,"Montolio tried to explain. "You see them as physical beings trying to control our actions for their own ends, and thus you, in your stubborn independance, reject them. The gods are within, I say, whether one has named his own or not. You have followed Mielikki all your life, Drizzt. You merely never had a name to put on your heart.

Author: Rohinton Mistry,  A Fine Balance
Quote: …God is a giant quiltmaker. With an infinite variety of designs. And the quilt is grown so big and confusing, the pattern is impossible to see, the squares and diamonds and triangles don’t fit well together anymore, it’s all become meaningless. So He has abandoned it.

Author: Thomas Deloney
Quote: God sends meat and the devil sends cooks.

Author: J.A. Konrath,  Origin
Quote: We don't know the Devil's side of the story, because God wrote all the books.

Author: Hany Adeeb
Quote: لا تستهين بنفسك ، حتى لو كنت قطرة ، محاولاتك المستمرة .. بصبر تستطيع أن تفتت الصخر

Author: George Bernard Shaw,  Saint Joan
Quote: Don't think you can frighten me by telling me that I am alone. France is alone. God is alone. And the loneliness of God is His strength.

Author: Jennifer Donnelly,  Revolution
Quote: Only the hopeless love God.

Author: Mechthild of Magdeburg,  Meditations from Mechthild of Magdeburg
Quote: A fish cannot drown in water,A bird does not fall in air.In the fire of creation,God doesn't vanish:The fire brightens.Each creature God mademust live in its own true nature;How could I resist my nature,That lives for oneness with God?

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: But I was always coming here. I though about one of my favorite Sufi poems, which says that God long ago drew a circle in the sand exactly around the spot where you are standing right now. I was never not coming here. This was never not going to happen.

Author: Nichole Nordeman
Quote: But what if you're wrong?What if there's more?What if there's hope you never dreamed of hoping for?What if you jump?And just close your eyes?What if the arms that catch you, catch you by surprise?What if He's more than enough?What if it's love?

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: Before you realize this truth, say the Yogis, you will always be in despair, a notion nicely expressed in this exasperated line from the Greek stoic philosopher Epictetus: 'You bear God within you, poor wretch, and know it not.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: Let our voices be heard. I hope they will not be shrill voices, but, I hope we shall speak with such conviction that those to whom we speak shall know of the strength of our feeling and the sincerity of our efforts.

Author: Stanley Victor Paskavich
Quote: Believe what you believe and it will be, believe what others believe and they will consume you!

Author: Wm. Paul Young
Quote: Even though you can't finally grasp me, guess what? I still want to be known.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: God didn’t give fear a body. God gave love a body.

Author: Edward Young
Quote: A foe to God was never true friend to man

Author: Marcus J. Borg,  The God We Never Knew: Beyond Dogmatic Religion to a More Authentic Contemporary Faith
Quote: The Christian life is not about pleasing God the finger-shaker and judge. It is not about believing now or being good now for the sake of heaven later. It is about entering a relationship in the present that begins to change everything now. Spirituality is about this process: the opening of the heart to the God who is already here.

Author: Joseph Campbell,  Thou Art That: Transforming Religious Metaphor
Quote: Is the god the source, or is the god a human manner of conceiving of the force and energy that supports the world? In our tradition God is a male. This male and female differentiation is made, however, within the field of time and space, the field of duality. If God is beyond duality, you cannot say that God is a "He."You cannot say God is a "She."You cannot say God is an "It."(18)

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Those who live as though God sets the rules are not going by their own rules. That is the self-sacrifice, or selflessness, that peace more often than not requires. Those who insist on going by their own rules cannot make that sacrifice. They are the steady adherents of (global) conflict because they are forever fighting both themselves and others to do whatever they think that they want to do.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: God is love, and he who abides in love abides in God, and God in him.

Author: Boyd K. Packer
Quote: Happiness is inseparably connected with decent, clean behavior.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Angel
Quote: Your angel cannot protect you against that which neither god nor the devil had made

Author: Werner Herzog
Quote: Jeder für sich und Gott gegen alle

Author: محمد متولي الشعراوي,  كيف تقرأ القرآن الكريم وتحفظه
Quote: كلمة : الآيات لا تطلق على مطلق موجود ، إنما تطلق على الموجود العجيب ، كما نقول : هذا آية في الحسن ، آية في الشجاعة ، فالآية علي الشيء العجيب .

Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables
Quote: There are, as we know, powerful and illustrious atheists. At bottom, led back to the truth by their very force, they are not absolutely sure that they are atheists; it is with them only a question of definition, and in any case, if they do not believe in God, being great minds, they prove God.

Author: Rumi
Quote: The way you make love is the way God will be with you.

Author: Deepak Chopra,  The Way of the Wizard: Twenty Spiritual Lessons for Creating the Life You Want
Quote: If you could really see that tree over there,"Merlin said, "you would be so astounded that you'd fall over.""Really? But why?"asked Arthur. "It's just a tree.""No,"Merlin said, "It's just a tree in your mind. To another mind it is an expression of infinite spirit and beauty. In God's mind it is a dear child, sweeter than anything you can imagine.

Author: Jeff Goins,  Wrecked: When a Broken World Slams into your Comfortable Life
Quote: I have realized that whatever good comes to me, comes from God, whatever bad comes to me, God has allowed it, and I choose to be thankful for both.

Author: John Piper,  Don't Waste Your Life
Quote: It was becoming clearer and clearer that if I wanted to come to the end of my life and not say, “I’ve wasted it!” then I would need to press all the way in, and all the way up, to the ultimate purpose of God and join him in it. If my life was to have a single, all-satisfying, unifying passion, it would have to be God’s passion.

Author: Evinda Lepins
Quote: Only God can take our failures and turn them into victories.

Author: Rachel Held Evans,  Evolving in Monkey Town: How a Girl Who Knew All the Answers Learned to Ask the Questions
Quote: What a comfort to know that God is a poet.

Author: Hans Urs von Balthasar,  Unless You Become Like This Child
Quote: To be a child means to owe one's existence to another, and even in our adult life we never quite reach the point where we no longer have to give thanks for being the person we are.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: New International Version
Quote: Let him who glories glory in this, That he understands and knows Me, That I am the LORD, exercising loving kindness, justice, and righteousness in the earth. For in these I delight,” says the LORD.

Author: Francis A. Schaeffer,  Art & the Bible
Quote: The ancients were afraid that if they went to the end of the earth they would fall off and be consumed by dragons. But once we understand that Christianity is true to what is there, true to the ultimate environment - the infinite, personal God who is really there - then our minds are freed. We can pursue any question and can be sure that we will not fall off the end of the earth.

Author: Sherman Alexie,  The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian
Quote: And believe me, a good piece of chicken can make anybody believe in the existence of God.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: You are not on a journey to God; you are on a journey WITH God.

Author: Allen Ginsberg,  Death and Fame: Last Poems, 1993-1997
Quote: I know I'm not God, are you? Don't be silly.God? God? Everybody's God? Don't be silly.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Four Loves
Quote: Every Christian would agree that a man's spiritual health is exactly proportional to his love for God.

Author: Ann Patchett,  Bel Canto
Quote: He realized now he was only just beginning to see the full extent to which it was his destiny to follow, to walk blindly into fates he could never understand. In fate there was reward, in turning over one's heart to God there was a magnificence that lay beyond description. At the moment one is sure that all is lost, look at what is gained!

Author: Ai Yazawa
Quote: It takes a lot of strength to hold onto and care for the things we love, so why is it that god seems to have made humans unable to conjure up that degree of power and love?

Author: Ernest Hemingway,  The Sun Also Rises
Quote: wonder what day god created the egg' 'how should we know? we should not question. our stay on earth is not for long. let us rejoice and believe and give thanks'. 'eat a egg

Author: Billy Graham,  Hope for Each Day: Words of Wisdom and Faith
Quote: Remember: He WANTS your fellowship, and He has done everything possible to make it a reality. He has forgiven your sins, at the cost of His own dear Son. He has given you His Word, and the priceless privilege of prayer and worship.

Author: Max Lucado
Quote: ‎Mark it down: God loves you with an unearthly love. You can't win it by being winsome. You can't lose it by being a loser. But you can be blind enough to resist it

Author: Jerry Stahl,  Permanent Midnight
Quote: To me, God is like this happy bus driver.

Author: Sri Aurobindo,  Savitri: A Legend and a Symbol
Quote: My God is love and sweetly suffers all.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  The Brothers Karamazov
Quote: Obedience, fasting, and prayer are laughed at, yet only through them lies the way to real true freedom. I cut off my superfluous and unnecessary desires, I subdue my proud and wanton will and chastise it with obedience, and with God's help I attain freedom of spirit and with it spiritual joy.

Author: Mike Yaconelli
Quote: Spirituality is not about being fixed; it is about God's being present in the mess of our unfixedness. (Messy Spirituality)

Author: Marquis de Sade
Quote: Anything beyond the limits and grasp of the human mind is either illusion or futility; and because your god having to be one or the other of the two, in the first instance I should be mad to believe in him, and in the second a fool.

Author: Osho
Quote: <…> God is a person; godliness is a quality. You cannot become God, but you can be godly. <...>

Author: Robert Uttaro,  To the Survivors
Quote: But no matter how much evil I see, I think it’s important for everyone to understand that there is much more light than darkness.

Author: Meister Eckhart
Quote: Whoever possesses God in their being has Him in a divine manner, and He shines out to them in all things; for them all things taste of God and in all things it is God's image that they see.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: No one can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and Money.

Author: Marianne Williamson
Quote: The highest prize we can receive for creative work is the joy of being creative. Creative effort spent for any other reason than the joy of being in that light filled space, love, god, whatever we want to call it, is lacking in integrity. . .

Author: Nicholas Wolterstorff,  Lament for a Son
Quote: But we all suffer. For we all prize and love; and in this present existence of ours, prizing and loving yield suffering. Love in our world is suffering love. Some do not suffer much, though, for they do not love much. Suffering is for the loving. This, said Jesus, is the command of the Holy One: "You shall love your neighbor as yourself."In commanding us to love, God invites us to suffer.

Author: Fulton J. Sheen
Quote: The principle of democracy is a recognition of the sovereign, inalienable rights of man as a gift from God, the Source of law.

Author: Mark Buchanan,  Your God Is Too Safe
Quote: Sometimes doubting is not a lack of faith, but an expression of it. Sometimes to doubt is to merely insist that God be taken seriously not frivolously, to insist that our faith is placed in and upheld by something other than seeming conjuring tricks.

Author: Beth Nimmo
Quote: There's no safety outside of God.

Author: Wendell Berry,  The Art of the Commonplace: The Agrarian Essays
Quote: Charity even for one person does not make sense except in terms of an effort to love all Creation in response to the Creator's love for it.

Author: Elisabeth Elliot
Quote: He is always doing something--the very best thing, the thing we ourselves would certainly choose if we knew the end from the beginning. He is at work to bring us to our full glory.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: It was a subtle refinement of God to learn Greek when he wished to write a book – and that he did not learn it better.

Author: Desiderius Erasmus
Quote: Bidden or unbidden, God is present.

Author: Neal Stephenson,  Snow Crash
Quote: Supposing that originally there was nothing but one creator, how could ordinary binary sexual relations come into being?

Author: Kristina McMorris,  Bridge of Scarlet Leaves
Quote: In seven days God had created the Earth. In a single day mankind had turned it upside down.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: Because your steadfast love is better than life, my lips will praise you.

Author: Kate Wicker,  Weightless: Making Peace with Your Body
Quote: We are beautiful because we are sons and daughters of God, not because we look a certain way.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: I want to be with God all the time. But I don't want to be a monk, or totally give up worldly pleasures. I guess what i want to learn is how to live in this world and enjoy its delights, but also devote myself to God.

Author: John F. MacArthur Jr.
Quote: What you cant forget... God cant remember!

Author: Truman Capote
Quote: all his prayers of the past had been simple concrete requests: God, give me a bicycle, a knife with seven blades, a box of oil paints. Only how, how, could you say something so indefinite, so meaningless as this: God, let me be loved.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: Blessed is the man who walks not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stands in the path of sinners, nor sits in the seat of the scornful; 2)But his delight is in the law of the Lord, and in His law he meditates day and night.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: Though the mills of God grind slowly, yet they grind exceeding small; Though with patience He stands waiting, with exactness grinds He all.

Author: James Baldwin,  The Fire Next Time
Quote: Whose little boy are you?

Author: Hans Christian Andersen
Quote: Almighty God, thee only have I; thou steerest my fate, I must give myself up to thee! Give me a livelihood! Give me a bride! My blood wants love, as my heart does!

Author: Mark Gorman
Quote: Only 8% of our worry will come to pass. 92% of our worry is wasted. DON'T PANIC

Author: Martin Amis,  The Second Plane: 14 Responses to September 11
Quote: It is straightforward—and never mind, for now, about plagues and famines: if God existed, and if he cared for humankind, he would never have given us religion.

Author: Nancy Leigh DeMoss
Quote: God lives in the place of praise. If we want to be where He is, we need to go to His address.

Author: John Steinbeck,  Cannery Row
Quote: Our Father who art in nature, who has given the gift of survival to the coyote, the common brown rat, the English sparrow, the house fly and the moth, must have a great and overwhelming love for no-goods and blots-on-the-town and bums, and Mack and the boys. Virtues and graces and laziness and zest. Our Father who art in nature.

Author: Robert A. Schuller
Quote: Open your eyes that you might see that all things are possible through you (with God's help)

Author: Arthur W. Pink,  The Attributes of God
Quote: Were God to show grace to all of Adam's descendants, men would at once conclude that He was righteously compelled to take them to heaven as meet compensation for allowing the human race to fall into sin. But the great God in under no obligation to any of his creatures, least of all to those who are rebels against him.

Author: John Green
Quote: Suffering can bend & break us. But it can also break us open to become the persons God intended us to be. It depends on what we do with the pain. If we offer it back to God, He will use it to do great things in us & through us, because suffering is fertile... it an grow new life.

Author: Israelmore Ayivor
Quote: There is no other way to determine the difference between the will of God and the crafts of satan... Jesus is the way, the truth and the life... The Holy Spirit of God is the Comforter...

Author: Mario Puzo,  The Godfather
Quote: I have no such powers. If I did I would be more merciful than God, believe me.

Author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut
Quote: Angels had fallen, men have sinned.It does not mean that God has failed.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 4: Season of Mists
Quote: They believe themselves Lucifer's equals, Cain, all these pitiful little gnats. But there is only one that we have ever owned to be our superior. There is but one greater than us, and to him... to him we no longer speak.

Author: Peter E. Gillquist,  Becoming Orthodox: A Journey to the Ancient Christian Faith
